head.title: Bed of Wilted Greens for Grilled Meat

ing.item: Fresh red bell pepper; cut into thin strips
Orange or tangerine; peeled and sectioned

directions.step:
From: PatH <phannema@wizard.ucr.edu>
Date: Wed, 15 May 1996 19:31:13 -0700 (PDT)
Recipe by: BH&G, Low-Fat & Luscious, 1996 Combine the dressing ingredients In a small bowl. For the greens, use a combination of spinach, mustard, collard, beet, chard, and/ or radicchio. Avoid older, tougher leaves. Remove rib from chard if too old. Tear large pieces (larger than 3 inches), placing them and the orange sections in a large bowl. In a large skillet, bring salad dressing mixture to boiling. Add red pepper strips. Remove skillet from heat. Pour hot mixture over the greens, tossing to mix. To serve with a grilled meat or fish steak... arrange some greens on individual dinner plate. Arrange some of the red pepper slices around the outside (perimeter). Place meat in center. Make a fan of 3 orange sections on the greens and garnish with zest strands or curls. Drizzle a spoonful of the dressing on top of the grilled entree.
